website_summaries.verdict: Includes a high-capacity absorbency that will catch those occasional accidents during potty training.
pros: Uses tear-away side panels so it's easier to remove the training pants after the child has an accident
Good design of training pants that fit like underwear
Includes fun animal print designs that kids will like
Company is committed to using eco-friendly materials
cons: May slow down the potty training process, as these training pants feel a lot like diapers

customer_reviews.title: ... this product in monthly delivery and usually it was fine. But in my last delivery with training pants ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this product in monthly delivery and usually it was fine. But in my last delivery with training pants was something wrong! They have awful smell, dirty color and pictures faded. Also my son has bad rash!!! I’m really disappointed. It some kind of fake 7 Generation pants! I attached pics with normal previous delivery and last one “fake” or damaged! I put bad one next to normal. You can compare colors, unfortunately I can’t show smell. Also filler inside feels like wed! I’m expecting some explanation from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Artem

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold much moisture - leaks almost every time
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought these due to the lack of synthetic materials used in manufacturing but these do not hold much moisture. Every morning, my toddler's pants will be wet because urine has leaked through these training pants. Worst of all, is after about even two hours in daytime usage, he will soak through these training pants and urine will drip into his socks and shoes. With no exaggeration, every day we have to go through multiple pairs of pants because these training diapers do not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: NYDNY

customer_reviews.title: Great! Just watch the price if you do monthly subscription.....
customer_reviews.text: I love these , super easy to put on and take off. I highly recommend these when your child is around 2 and is more aware of telling you that they have gone pee. They hold around 1-2 urinations....... I use regular diapers too when diaper rash cream is needed, as these are not easy to get on without getting rash cream on the training pants. The only thing I don’t like with Amazon monthly subscribe is that you order them at 37.00 and then if you by chance check the price it has jumped up to 48.00 a box and they don’t notify you of the price change!
customer_reviews.author: S. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for overnight
customer_reviews.text: We have had this product on subscribe and save for the past 1.5 years since my daughter has potty trained. She still needs a pull up for nights, and even when we nursed right before bedtime or when she drinks a lot of water before bed, it still manages to hold in all the pee and never leak. I'm very surprised by all the poor reviews as we have never had an issue with them even when the company switched from the brown color to the white color.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold any moisture
customer_reviews.text: These were terrible. I have used seventh generation diapers on my babies/toddlers, but these didn’t hold anything at all. We used them at night for daytime potty-trained toddler. He peed even a little and he was soaked. You’d be just as well to wear undies. We just put two together so that we didn’t waste the entire box.
customer_reviews.author: swifty

customer_reviews.title: Cured a horrible allergic reaction to other pull-ups
customer_reviews.text: My daughter, who doesn't have particularly sensitive skin, had a horrible allergic rash on her lower back (weird place, I know) caused by Target brand pull-ups and diapers, which she only sleeps in (she's potty-trained during the day). We switched her to these, and it disappeared in 2 days. That tells me there is some questionable stuff in the other brands....kinda creepy. These pull-ups have an excellent fit. I highly recommend. Healthy skin is worth the money if you can shell it out. I do wish they would find a way to make these cheaper, though. The cost is the only reason I didn't give these 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Zaynee

customer_reviews.title: These are good for potty training but not to leave on for ...
customer_reviews.text: These are good for potty training but not to leave on for night time. They do not fit tightly enough for night time/bedtime. My grandbaby woke up with his clothes and blankets wet. I bought these to use instead of diapers because he is potty trained and does well during the day. I bought these so he could go to the potty at night like a big boy and have protection, in case he did not wake up or didn't quite make it. So, for now, we use the seventh generation diapers, which work great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: These aren't the most absorbent training pants (which is a pro and a con). We want the kiddo to be aware of his wetness...but he literally peed through the pants, down his leg, through his socks, and his shoes onto the floor in one wetting while wearing these (just after a failed potty trip, of course). If your tot has super-soaker tendencies, be very vigilant if they're wearing these. We've had to do a lot of laundry lately. These also don't hold soft BMs well. And they chafe around the legs when kiddo is active. We're contemplating either other training pants or a different potty training approach. This is not working out for us.
customer_reviews.author: Starligh06

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper..ignore those horrible reviews..try it yourself and judge!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is very easily irritated and these diapers keep that from happening. The absorbion is good and they don't smell like chemicals. I'd highly recommend these diapers especially if your little ones bottom is irritated easily. I was skeptical after reading the reviews on here but they do not match up to the diaper. I loved these and would recommend for any parent to try!
customer_reviews.author: Teagan

customer_reviews.title: Bad product this month!
customer_reviews.text: So I’m not sure what happened, if I got fake Seventh Generation pull-ups or some type of manufacturing error! I have them on auto ship every month & something is clearly wrong with these! They are a different color and some of the design has changed (see attached photos)! The photo on the LEFT is the new ones I just received & the one on the RIGHT is the old one left over from the last pack! The color is off, there is a code on the bottom that says Size 3 (I order 2T/3T), the top dots are cut off, & they have a smell! I’ll be calling Amazon bout this, because this is ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like the seventh generation diapers any sizes
customer_reviews.text: I really like the seventh generation diapers any sizes, but not so much the training pants. I have no choice my baby is so big and not ready to potty train. They are to thin at the bottom! They don't cover enough so they leak very quickly. It is too bad cause since I switched to pampers my son is having quiet often some rash, but never did with the seventh generation diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Celine

customer_reviews.title: Good training pants
customer_reviews.text: Work great as training pants. If your little one is still wetting heavily expect some leaks. The leg openings may be kind of large for skinnier kids. We once had a "leak" where my son soaked his pants, shoes and socks and the training pant was completely dry. He's super skinny and was sitting, I guess the leg opening was just so that the stream went straight out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I trust Seventh Generation with my 2yo because they use ingredients I can understand and seem to have what is best for everyone in mind. These have great stretch and are easy for my 2yo to pull up and down by herself. She wears them at bedtime and we have had no leaks on the occasion she does pee overnight. There have been no complaints, so they must be pretty comfortable. The quantity is great and the price is acceptable for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Black1304

customer_reviews.title: Lots of blow outs down the leg
customer_reviews.text: I’m sad because seventh gen diapers are our go to!! They’ve been the only things he doesn’t leak through at night. These training pants however, seem to have not enough stretch around the thighs, or something as every poop has leaked out and on to his clothes, at least a little. I won’t buy these again, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive skin and night potty training
customer_reviews.text: So glad to have a more natural option for my daughter who has sensitive skin. These are perfect for her at night when potty train is a bit more challenging and for on the go for children who are intimidated by adult toilets. They do tend to ride a bit crooked on her but I'm wondering if they may run bigger than other brands and if I should have gone with a smaller size. Overall very happy with the product and if need be I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great pull up for toddlers with very sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Very great for toddlers with very sensitive skin- my son couldn’t even tolerate the Honest Brand pull ups- his skin started getting red and irritated with just one use, so we tried this brand to see if it’d work since Earths Best doesn’t make a pull up, and our sons skin wasn’t irritated at all. I also love the cute little fox on them. Easy to tear sort at the sides when you need to, but not so easy that your toddler will be able to.
customer_reviews.author: Rhea

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of training pants. My child has very sensitive skin so finding training pants with no chemicals is very very important. Since we have been using this brand this is our #1 choice for our kid. No skin reactions, no leaks, and to comfortable for potty training lol.
customer_reviews.author: Elza

customer_reviews.title: Not meant to replace regular diapers
customer_reviews.text: We use the Seventh Generation regular and overnight diapers and love them both. We've never had issues with leaks so were very surprised to find that my toddler's pants were repeatedly wet with these training pants, which we're starting to use as a pre-potty training exercise. It seems that these are much thinner and with inferior side elastics to the regular diapers. As much as I pull them up, they still seem to sag, leaving less than an ideal fit, especially at the lower end. They might work fine for the occasional accident, but not a great option if you just want a pull up with regular absorption.
customer_reviews.author: mjsmjs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pull on, easy for parents to tear off for quick changes at night (sleeping)
customer_reviews.text: Our little girl enjoys the monkey & fox pull-ups, and can easily use put them on and off. When she has a bowel movement at night, the sides rip fairly easily and I can sweep out the poohs, clean up the bum, and put on a regular diaper for the remainder of the night (with side sticky flaps) w/o waking her.
customer_reviews.author: David Jackemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Bad absorbency, leaks!
customer_reviews.text: We normally use another brand of pull ups for night time. But I snagged these up when they went on sale for prime day. I put one on my son during the day and he leaked up the back...tried again that night and leaked again. The absorbency is not good. Very unhappy with this purchase bc I cannot use these day or night.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Everwood

customer_reviews.title: ... all cleaners from this brand but these diapers were terrible quality!
customer_reviews.text: I use all cleaners from this brand but these diapers were terrible quality!!!! Not sure if it just was a bad batch. There were very hard spots on diaper like small pieces of wood glued together. Didn't use them!
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent material is separated and bunches up easily.
customer_reviews.text: I only use “non-toxic” products...so when my daughter started potty training, I decided to try these pull ups. They are horrible. The absorbent material bunches up into uncomfortable balls. My daughter complained of them “hurting” and they “itched”. I will never purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: SurferGirl

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I used seventh gen diapers the whole time that my daughter was in them. Pull ups, overnights, wipes too! It took a while for them to be a good fit for my son but he's in them now! I say good fit because when he was a small baby they did leak some. Especially at night. But now that he's older they are fine and never leak. I feel good about using these abs putting him in these.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleyedenfield

customer_reviews.title: You can get much better for the price. Parasol.
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are ok.. I purchased these because Amazon was out of my parasol training diapers which I subscribe to, very disappointed and will be looking to change my subscription either to parasol or give hello bello a try. I was not impressed with these, these absorbent was ok, the softness ok, and fit ok, simplicity and ease of use... also ok.. everything was ok, compared to the parasol terrible. The parasol diapers are far better than these and same price.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Want to love.. but needs improvement!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the regular seventh generation diapers with my 7 month old since he was born, and they have been pretty great. These training ones though, seem like they fit a bit uncomfortably (the way they are shaped) & have been leaking more than we would like. Considering going back to the pampers ones which are softer & do not leak... BUT, the fact that they're scentless & more natural is making us give it another go.
customer_reviews.author: tmn

customer_reviews.title: Moms must have made these training pants!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only training pants/diapers my son can wear! They allow air to travel and always help him get through diaper rashes that were caused by other brands. I won’t switch again! Subscribe and save!!!! I will say either my son is picking up weight or the sizing is a little off but I know it’s different with each brand and each kid! No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy_mogul

customer_reviews.title: Like very much !!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We use these at night. Call them "Nightime Panties" or "Nap Panties" until she is 100% potty trained. Like them much better than putting on reg diapers. Great absorbancy.
customer_reviews.author: Moi

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this. Many leaks.
customer_reviews.text: Since it is very hard to find training pants for sensitive skins, I decided to give this a try. But after having so many blowouts, I decided I cannot take it anymore. There was one time when my son pooped through the diaper and it was all in his pants!!!! I don't even know how it happened that it did not capture almost anything. I know I put it on right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great training diaper
customer_reviews.text: I love seventh generation because my son never gets rashes and they are pretty good at absorbing. The designs are cute too 😊 price seems competitive for natural diapers though I wish it was a little cheaper I’m glad it is available. I wish they carried these in stores!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kiddo and mommy approved.
customer_reviews.text: They worked great for the short time my kid needed them. My kid loved the big girl feel to them. And mommy loves the trust of the Seveth Generation beans. Going to be using them for my next kid.
customer_reviews.author: alyndsay

customer_reviews.title: The best diapers ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best diapers on the planet, and I have purchased evey brand out there. They are so soft, no harmful chemicals, and easy to get on and off. I highly recommend these to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Mick F

customer_reviews.title: So soft! No leaks, no worries!
customer_reviews.text: These training pants are the best! They are soft, they don't leak, and they have no harmful chemicals. My little ones always struggle with breaking out from training pants/diapers...and they never have that issue with these. They almost feel like real underwear, they are so soft!
customer_reviews.author: Katertha

customer_reviews.title: No better than cheaper brands
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these b/c I thought they were more environmentally friendly. Wrong. A disposable diaper is still a disposable diaper. There is no difference between these and there regular ones. Go cloth folks. Softbums are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi M.

customer_reviews.title: Good training not for overnight
customer_reviews.text: Good training diapers but not good for overnight use. Would get overwhelmed and she would wet the bed. Other than that did what it was supposed to but just don’t recommend for long term use as diapers gets over saturated easily
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend these training pants
customer_reviews.text: I definitely recommend these training pants! They are made with natural materials which are safer to use against your child's skin versus the bleached and colored alternatives. The sides are not tear away so it is easier for the child to pull up and down while potty training. They don't have characters on them like some other brands, but my little one doesn't seem to mind. Great buy, especially the subscribe and save option!
customer_reviews.author: Scruffles01

customer_reviews.title: Eco-friendly option in a small size!
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find somewhat eco-friendly training pants in small sizes. We started our son in these at 16 months and have not had any problems with leaking or blow-outs. But he is actively potty training, visiting (and using) the potty many times a day. He is average size for his age and they were a bit big at 16 mos. but fit fine now at 22mos. I'm glad these are available on Amazon, as I can't buy them locally.
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers don't give my child diaper rash and most conventional diapers give him a horrible rash. They are very soft and comfortable, too. I would rather give them 4 1/2 stars...my only complaint is that they sometimes leak overnight. But maybe it is a boy thing, that never happened with my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: cloth diapering momma

customer_reviews.title: good training pants, cute designs
customer_reviews.text: good training pants i bought my little one these training pants after forgetting them at the store... again, but had enough to get by until they delivered them they are great training pants and worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I like them!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, first time purchased to try and most likely we will stick with this amazing quality training pants
customer_reviews.author: Zberes

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it but cannot recommend
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to give baby a rash multiple times (which is odd considering the lack of chemicals), absorbency was bad, sizing was too small width wise. But the design is cute.
customer_reviews.author: Pookie

customer_reviews.title: Good for overnight
customer_reviews.text: I use these just for night time. These work well. I haven't had many leak issues except when he's gone potty before bed and I don't make sure it got pulled back up correctly. But I do wish they had the side easy open pull tabs so I could change him without taking off his pants. The nice part about not having the easy open though is he can't just rip it off.
customer_reviews.author: JulieG

customer_reviews.title: The rash she had with other brands has been better since we switched
customer_reviews.text: The backside is smaller than name brand training pants, and they seem to give my little one a wedgie and sometimes leak. The rash she had with other brands has been better since we switched, but we also started allergy medicine, so not sure what caused it.
customer_reviews.author: kke

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these training diapers. They hold everything in and have a large capacity. Sturdy too. Update...April 2015 Something has changed with these training diapers and they now suck. I used them with my first child and liked them, now with my second I find they are loose around the legs (I have a beefy boy) and they are guaranteed to leek, or worse if he poops. Find an alternative until they fix this issue or you'll suffer. The diapers are still great.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love these diapers and love that they are available in pull ups. They are soft and elastic on the sides so my toddler is able to pull them down with ease while we are potty training, and they stay in place very well with all his active play. Very absorbent. We never get leaks in these. I have been using Seventh Generation Diapers since my boy was born 3 years ago and he has NEVER had diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: 2Expensive4BadQuality
customer_reviews.text: These diapers r junk n expensive for no reason because they leak out the sides and they don't cover very much backside they almost fit the description of a butt flosser.
customer_reviews.author: adi

customer_reviews.title: Wedgies, mishaps, and misaligned.
customer_reviews.text: My baby is only one year old (22lbs) and his butt hardly fits in these, they always end up giving him wedgies, and they have just caused a massive blowout. Some of the other reviewers believe that these are knock-offs and I'm starting to agree. The pictures on the front and back are weirdly faded, and some of them have printed words that are usually misaligned or not even there. Maybe this batch should be recalled.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice but made big
customer_reviews.text: Like that they or organic but fit wayyyyyy too big! My son is 3 and 35 pounds and these were almost falling off of him
customer_reviews.author: Just a Mom

customer_reviews.title: Does not absorb at all
customer_reviews.text: This is the most terrible pull up I’ve ever used ! Every single time my toddler pees when he’s sleeping it literally catches nothing and he gets woken up completely wet while the diaper is still dry ! The most horrible pull up I’ve ever used ! DO NOT BUY THEM
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son is 11-months, weighs about 25 pounds, ...
customer_reviews.text: My son is 11-months, weighs about 25 pounds, and these were so large on him that he was complaining when I put them on him. They came up very high on his tummy. He can wear some 2T items--so I was hoping that he might just be big enough, but he wasn't. I wish they had had a minimum weight listed or had a smaller size available for sale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pull on and take off. Absorbent. Don't smell.
customer_reviews.text: While my daughter is potty training, we have been using these pull-up style pants. She used to wear them during the day. Now she only wears them at night in case she pees. They are easy to pull on and take off. They also have the break-away sides, which help make poop clean-up easier. These diapers are expensive, but they are effective and they don't smell like baby powder. Overall, we have been really pleased with them--and all Seventh Generation diapers, honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated mom, tired of washing sheets, sleep sacks and jammies
customer_reviews.text: These leaked a lot. The absorbent part seems to be very narrow. A lot of pee can leak out of the sides. My daughter would nap in them and we had so many accidents :( SO much laundry!
customer_reviews.author: DuckDivah

customer_reviews.title: I like that these pull ups are safer for my son ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that these pull ups are safer for my son and don’t smell like chemicals. However he gets a wedgie often and complains about the pull up creeping and the waist is large and my son is tall and thin.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Webb

customer_reviews.title: Promissing but deceiving
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of using environment friendly diapers but seriously this is impossible. The diapers are NOT comfortable and well designed... My toddler kept of getting rashes from these and pee was just going through the sides... Hope you can improve those so they become a hit.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Lourenco

customer_reviews.title: Leaky!
customer_reviews.text: Leaky, leaky, leaky. Like, within a short time of putting them on they leak. No margin of error for accidents. Will try again when we are closer to the end of potty training.
customer_reviews.author: jim rodman

customer_reviews.title: It is good for the environment
customer_reviews.text: It is good for the environment, but there is no urine notification line and there is no tape, so it is very difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Hayoung  JEONG

customer_reviews.title: Good for light accidents during day, not great for sleep
customer_reviews.text: Fairly small, not great for overnight. Kid just moved up to 3T pants from 2T and he floods these no matter how many times we take him to the potty before bed and just before we go to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks really comfortable unlike other brands.
customer_reviews.text: Really cute and looks really comfortable. Easy to pull up and down for little one.During day it's fine but it won't hold for the whole night. I found my son with wet pajamas.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: So much better than pull-ups
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE! These are my favorite training pants. So much better than pull-ups. They are not bulky, but still absorbent. I love the simple design (you can't see characters through clothes) and the fact that there is no velcro (you just tear them apart along a slight perforation) means little can't take them off without a bit of effort. I also love the fact that there are some many fewer chemicals. I recommend these to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin or allergies
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing for kids with allergies and or sensitive skin. Only issue is pulling them down is difficult for them sometimes and they won’t make it on time to the toilet. However that is my ONLY issue with these. They’re fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for overnight use!
customer_reviews.text: These pull-ups are completely non-absorbent. We switched to these from a more expensive natural pull-up brand (in which we never had a leak), and she has been soaked through every night. Clearly not designed to work overnight!
customer_reviews.author: N. Uspensky

customer_reviews.title: These are very easy for my daughter to pull on and plenty big
customer_reviews.text: These are very easy for my daughter to pull on and plenty big, some pullups are too snug! The only complaint is that they do leak a bit, but the point is to use the potty, so that shouldn't really be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of three

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Good
customer_reviews.text: We don't like these at all. Not very absorbent and leak out the sides, even though they fit perfectly in the waist. Falling apart after wearing for only a couple of hours. Don't withstand being pulled up and down to go potty, or our very active daughter. Amazon's price is really compared to store pricing and other trainers on here, so I decided to try them. Going to finish up the packs we have and go back to Pull-Ups.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: I Love these Pull-Ups/Training Pants!!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried all the different chlorine-free diapers when my kids were younger, and Seventh Generation was always at the bottom of my list. However, the Training Pants are great! (Lucky for me, because there aren't as many options for training pants) The elastic-like material on the side is very strong and feels very comfortable. My twins started using them at 27 months - my one child was already potty trained so used them just for nap and nighttime (no leaks yet) and my other child just started potty-training but doesn't have any trouble pulling them up or down by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Eddi

customer_reviews.title: Love these diapers
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers. Of all the "chemical" free diapers, these are made in the USA. Some of the other companies are made in Mexico and I like supporting a company who is keeping jobs at home. My only request to Seventh Generation is to start putting some cute designs on the diapers for the kiddos. These diapers are a great choice for kiddos with sensitive skin. Some of the other "chemical free" diapers seem to irritate my sons skin around the top of the diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: They are even good as night time diapers
customer_reviews.text: How can you go wrong? We have never had a problem with these. They are even good as night time diapers! Safer for the environment. Safer for your child's sensitive bottom. And if you are an "amazon mom," 20% off!! Best brand on the market!
customer_reviews.author: prime lover

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't look so bulky like others, great for potty training.
customer_reviews.author: gaby

customer_reviews.title: My favorite brand for the toddler
customer_reviews.text: Big fans of this product for my toddler who I am potty training. They are convenient- she can wear them pretty easily, she loves the fox-leaf design and chooses a side each time and i like that it has never given her a rash!
customer_reviews.author: Biker mom

customer_reviews.title: The Only One for Us
customer_reviews.text: These are the only trainers I use for my daughter. When she was a baby it was the only brand of diaper I would use. They don't irritate her sensitive skin, nor do they swell up and overflow. And now that she is getting to be independent, she is able to pull them down on her own - no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela

customer_reviews.title: Love these. Use when we leave the house
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Use when we leave the house. As long as the body parts are in the correct spots no leaking. Never used over night because they aren't meant for that. Happy that someone makes a pull up with out all the chemicals
customer_reviews.author: Cat P

customer_reviews.title: I love these diapers for her
customer_reviews.text: These diapers were a life saver for us! Our daughter was battling severe little girl issues and was in pain constantly. We switched to dye free fragrance free diapers, wipes, bath soaps, shampoos, and diaper cream and she hasn’t had a complication yet! I love these diapers for her! I just wish I could buy them in a store close to me!
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I think I received a fake product:-((( I read about it in some reviews and now I agree with them! Terrible quality, leaks, bad adsorption and smell...Do not recommend to buy them! Amazon, please do a quality check !!!
customer_reviews.author: Roman Sakharov

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only diapers I use for my little one, they are great! She never gets diaper rash with them and they are very absorbent!
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Daytime protection
customer_reviews.text: Meh. I like the style and fit but only need them for overnight and they leak. Better than underwear but not the best for overnight. Would prob work great for daytime.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Constant Leaks
customer_reviews.text: We got these to aid with potty training for our 2 1/2 yr old, but they constantly leak. Just put one on him to try and two minutes later he comes to me with pee all over his pants. Have had several leaks during naps as well. Admittedly, he is on the lower end for weight and has skinny legs, but we rarely have issues with his size 6 SG diapers. We only use SG diapers because of past rash problems, but I just cancelled my subscription for the pull-ups. Just not worth the trouble for us.
customer_reviews.author: KeithSVA

customer_reviews.title: keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using nurtured by nature diapers and I have liked them. We are now to the pull ups phase and they don't make pull ups. I tried these but won't reorder. My husband says it looks like our child is wearing a paper lunch sack. Th at isn't the main problem though. They just don't hold much. My child can easily wet more than these hold in a nap time.
customer_reviews.author: TX Mom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Training Pants
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing, we tried many other brands of "natural" training pants with our first child and had many leaking issues. No problems with these. We do wish they were a little easier to tear on the sides but overall we're very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: alicia

customer_reviews.title: Love the product
customer_reviews.text: The size fit in a little larger than I thought it would. Next time will buy 2T3T. Otherwise love it
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Mildew smell
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t even get to try these on my son, because as soon as I opened them up, the smell of mildew hit my nose. All of pull-ups smelled like where ever they were stored. Unfortunately, I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a hard to find in stores
customer_reviews.text: So prefer these style to the Velcro tab closures. Great value for a hard to find in stores product
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Best brand we have found for dryness and sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: Best we have found for night times for the little one. She's potty trained, but still needs some help at night, some night. Fit is great and the best brand for her sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewThisPAL

customer_reviews.title: Poor fitting and not sufficiently absorbent.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised after trying this brands diapers and being quite happy with them that the training pants were so bad. They are not wide enough to cover my toddlers whole backside and this allows leakage. They also leak before they are very saturated and therefore my toddler is frequently wetting through by morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent, scratchy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is daytime potty trained so we use these at night. I like the natural angle for these but the edges are a bit scratchy in the last batch and now I have to trim them before bedtime which is of course a huge ordeal with a 3 year old (drama!). And occasionally they get bunched up and she pees out the side of them.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: My daughter refused to wear them
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old hated these. Would not wear them. They feel very stiff
customer_reviews.author: Kara Carter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment....lraking through within one hour
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this brand. Yes they are not as expensive as other brands but after adding up the costs for all the additional laundry I was required to wash due to these diapers leaking through within an hour I should have bought Huggies. I do not recommend these at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: These pull ups don't cover well in the back. They have a cheap look to them & the color make them look old. However they hold up well with absorbency.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Good but no back front
customer_reviews.text: Hi I like the Sevneth generation products due to their earth friendliness. However these pants could do with some improvements: No mention of the side(back/front) making it less easy to quickly putn on diapers. Aksi tge sides are too "tight" and not easy to rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for nighutime
customer_reviews.text: These are great for nighttime use, but without the velcro tab/zippers, they aren't practical to use at preschool, since you have to take of pants and shoes to put a new pair on. We are still using them at night, because we love the brand and they work great, but really wish they would make the option of resealable tabs.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers and the environmental consciousness of the company.
customer_reviews.author: Lit234

customer_reviews.title: I love Seventh Generation products but these diapers are not a ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Seventh Generation products but these diapers are not a very good quality product. The diapers leak 8 out of 10 times. And most develop a tear between the absorbent part and the elastic part. I will never buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Hot KK

customer_reviews.title: Great for training!
customer_reviews.text: We used Seventh Generation diapers from the start. When it was time to start potty training our son, we switched over to these training pants. Just keep in mind these do no hold nearly as much fluids as regular diapers! I am happy to say we are fully potty trained now, and we recommend Seventh Generation diapers, wipes, and training pants to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: C Jung

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Hard to get off and can not hold through the night.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Pants
customer_reviews.text: Higher quality than "pull-ups." The sides don't fall apart as easily, but they do tear when needed. Capacity is just fine. My 2 1/2 year old sleeps in them with no leaks. He can pull them off alone but can't get them back up without help. The pants will go down and up multiple times and still stay together.
customer_reviews.author: GNapier

customer_reviews.title: Fits great for a small child
customer_reviews.text: One of two brands of diapers that do not give my daughter diaper rash. These training pants are easy to get on and off and fit my small for her age 3 year old perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Acompst

customer_reviews.title: We've been using these for about 3. 5 years ...
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these for about 3.5 years now, with all three of our kids when they reached the almost leaving diapers stage. Worked for our kids with skinny legs and chunky legs. Was not thrilled when they choose to advertise a movie (The Lorax) on the diapers themselves, but thankfully that stopped.
customer_reviews.author: nancydiazlem

customer_reviews.title: I use this brand of regular diapers and love them! I'll put a fresh pull up on ...
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for these! I use this brand of regular diapers and love them! I'll put a fresh pull up on my daughter and the pee comes out of the sides, top, bottom, resulting in a complete wardrobe change. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price homie
customer_reviews.text: These are the only pull ups that really work on my daughter. Also 30 something dollars for 100 of them?! You can't beat that! I need these to be available again for at least 6 more months I'm begging you lol
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable affordable great item Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Reasonable affordable great item Cons: no velcro side closure
customer_reviews.author: Terilyn

customer_reviews.title: Love Seventh Generation
customer_reviews.text: Love Seventh Generation! They fit perfectly (much better then more popular training pants) and are well absorbent. I used Amazon Mom to get a discount. My son is a very tall 24 months and the 2T-3T fit well.
customer_reviews.author: J D

customer_reviews.title: Cured toddler rash woes
customer_reviews.text: Cured a rash on my toddlers butt. Was previously using pampers and appreciate this non-chemical alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Cann

customer_reviews.title: Works great despite being tab-less
customer_reviews.text: Love them just hate they don’t have tabs. Whenever there’s an accident you have to fully undress child to change training pants which is a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Sarajeni

product_meta.title: Seventh Generation Baby & Toddler Training Pants, Large Size 3T-4T, 88 count (Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description: Size:LargeYou’re making moves, kid. Seventh Generation Free & Clear Training Pants are designed to make potty training easier. Our pull on training pants fit like big kid underpants, but with an absorbent core to keep your toddler protected and dry – just in case. Our Free & Clear Training Pants are fragrance-free and made for sensitive skin, and contain 0% chlorine bleaching or lotions. This toddler training underwear makes it easy to tell front from back, and the tear away side panels allow for a quick, easy change. Our Protection for All design features two of our adorable furry friends, Ferris the Fox and Ophelia the Orangutan, doing big kid things. We care about our forest friends and our forests. That’s why we use FSC certified sustainably sourced wood fluff pulp in the core of our diapers FSC C115279). Whether it’s keeping your toddler dry, or preserving our forests – we’re dedicated to protection you can trust. Caring for a little human is a magical undertaking, and we’ve developed an entire line of diapers and baby personal care products to bring peace of mind to your journey. Our full collection Free & Clear diapers, training pants, and overnights are designed to grow with your family through every life-changing milestone. *The absorbent core of our diapers is not bleached or processed with chemicals containing chlorine
feature_bullets: Weight Recommendation: 32 to 40 Pounds. Training pants made for toddler’s sensitive skin, great for boys or girls
Absorbent core ready for life’s surprises
Contains 0% chlorine bleaching*, lotions, or fragrances
Fits like big kid underpants – easy to tell front from back and tear away side panels allow for a quick, easy change
Shipment includes 88-count size large 3T-4T potty training diapers, fits children 32-40lbs

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
